required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Biodegradable Stents: Orsiro and BioMatrix
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Biodegradable Stents: Orsiro and BioMatrix

brief_summary.textblock:
The use of a biodegradable polymer has the potential to reduce the sustained inflammatory response of the arterial wall, facilitating re-endothelialization and minimizing the risk of thrombus formation and late restenosis. In the study, we are going to two biodegradable polymer stents, Orsiro and BioMatrix, especially regarding the stent strut coverage by optical coherence tomography at 3 months after stent implantation.
The primary objective of this study is to test the hypothesis that Orsiro is non-inferior to Biomatrix in terms of stent strut coverage by optical coherence tomography at 3 months. The secondary endpoint is clinical outcomes up to 1 year.

detailed_description.textblock:
The use of a biodegradable polymer has the potential to reduce the sustained inflammatory response of the arterial wall, facilitating re-endothelialization and minimizing the risk of thrombus formation and late restenosis. In the study, we are going to two biodegradable polymer stents, Orsiro and BioMatrix, especially regarding the stent strut coverage by optical coherence tomography at 3 months after stent implantation.
The primary objective of this study is to test the hypothesis that Orsiro is non-inferior to Biomatrix in terms of stent strut coverage by optical coherence tomography at 3 months. The secondary endpoint is clinical outcomes up to 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: Neointimal coverage at 3 month after stent implantation
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of stent uncoverage measured by optical coherence tomography

intervention.intervention_name: Drug-eluting biodegradable stent BioMatrix or BioMatrix Flex implantation
intervention.description: Drug-eluting biodegradable stent BioMatrix or BioMatrix Flex implantation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients â‰¥ 20 years old
2. Patients in the treatment of subjects with all-comer who are to undergo PCI
Exclusion Criteria:

2. Life expectancy < 1 year

facility.name: Division of Cardiology, Yonsei Cardiovascular Hospital, Yonsei University College of Medicine, Seodaemun-gu, Shinchondong
